Reviews.Title: Great deal, but you've gotta work for it
Reviews.Author: Pat Denoli
Reviews.Content: I'm usually pretty good with bad English translations in my instruction manuals, but this product is pretty rough.  You often can't tell if the manual is telling you that something needs to be done in order to make something happen, that it shouldn't be done if you want it to happen... or if you need to make the second thing happen (some other way) in order for the first thing to be taken care of.  Use of negatives and double-negatives is a challenge, too.  If you are familiar with the configuration of network gear, try to forget what you know.  It doesn't work *exactly* the same with this camera.  You're better off as a novice, I think.Since it burned 15 hours of my time, here's a possible help for some people about to return their camera because "wireless isn't working".  This is for people who manually assign IPs, or who don't understand why the camera isn't finding any wireless networks.  Understand that the camera has to be set it up in very specific stages.  You can't make all your changes at once.  Also, you must use the proprietary software to connect to the camera over Ethernet the first time. Don't use other software. Make sure you set your router for dynamic IP allocation.  Next, you reboot through software.  Next you power cycle.  Log into the camera using IE.  It says you can use other browsers, but don't.  NOW set up the wireless properties.  Save them, remove the ethernet cable.  Reboot through software and then power cycle (yes, that's two boots).  Log in again.  NOW change the IP assignment from dynamic to manual.  Save and reboot through software and then power cycle.  You won't find these instructions in the manual.  I had to stumble upon it and I've repeated the process with minor variations to be sure - nothing else works.  Good grief!!!!!!!  I was about to pack these things up and ship them back.  Looks like they work fine if you know the right dance.  I'm using 128 bit WEP.  If you're using something else - good luck to you.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: My Opinion
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned after reading all of the posts complainingabout how hard their experiences were in setting up this camera.Aside from that, the ratings were good, the price was right, and sinceI have 20 years IT experience and am a glutton for punishment,  Iordered one.  Actually I need at least three, but I wanted to buy oneas a test, and if it passed, I'd buy the additional two cameras.I ordered this camera and several days later it was already in mymailbox.  I unpacked it, and was going to put off configuring it untilChristmas day, when I would have had much of the day to play with it.Being the workaholic that I am, I decided to go ahead and try andconfigure it within minutes of deciding I wasn't going to do it.  Igot out the instruction book and started going through the steps, oneby one.  The grammar kind of bothered me, you can tell Englishwasn't a native language for the technical document writer.  I'm notgoing to lie, you're going to need a bit of technical experience toget this camera connected, but it's not the camera's fault.  With allthe security that's around nowadays, along with all the possible setupscenarios, it's likely never going to be a plug and play scenario toget an IP camera working. I'll bottom line you though  - it was worthit.  I love this thing!My first bit of advice is to take the instruction book that's insidethe box, and put it directly into your trash can. Seriously.  Thatbook is flawed and you're going to need the Hubble Telescope to readthe small print to begin with. Follow the manual on the CD that's inthe box.  There are guides on the CD. One is a User Manual PDF and theother is a quick guide.  Follow the User Manual for it's a bit moredetailed.  Now let me describe my equipment and the steps I took toget this camera configured.  My equipment: Linksys Wireless Router, PCrunning Windows XP Pro SP3, Cable Mode for Internet connection.If you want this thing to email you photos when the motion sensor istripped (or to connect to it via the Internet, which is why you'relooking at an IP camera to begin with), then you're going to need anInternet connection.  You'll need at least a Cable modem.  I can'timagine how slow it will be if you have DSL and you're trying toconnect to this camera over the Internet.  So, I've got a Cable modem,Linksys wireless router, and a NON SSL POP email account.  YOU CANNOTUSE GMAIL WITH THE CURRENT FIRMWARE WITH THIS CAMERA.  Gmail requiresSSL and the SMTP client on this camera as of today is not written forSSL, so save yourself some time in trying to do it anyway.  Unless youuse STunnel from [...], it's just not going to happen.  Since Ihave several email accounts, I simply chose one that I knew didn'trequire SSL (it's a hosted account I have with Rochen, with gives youthe option to use their non SSL SMTP port 1025 which will work with this camera, or to use the more common Secure SMTP like that of Gmail which won't work with this camera.)Quick steps of what I did:Step 1: Screw the antenna into the camera. Plug the network cable intothe camera and then into an available port on your wireless router.Plug the power cable into the wall and then into the camera.Step 2: Now on your computer, which is also running through yourrouter, run the IP Camera tool from the CD, but first make sure youexit any web browsers you may have open.  You may have to reboot yourcomputer after the IP Camera Tool installation.Step 3:  You should be reading through the User Manual at this point,as there are many possibilities for your current setup.  You shouldhave also already thrown the printed manual into your trash can whereit rightfully belongs. Run the IP Cameral Tool icon from the desktopif you had to reboot your computer.  Your camera should show up inthat list as anonymous, followed by[...]  Personally, I'm running DHCP soan IP was already assigned to the camera when it booted.  If youdouble click on the IP address of the camera in the IP Camera Toolwindow, it will bring up a web browser window for you to login to thecamera.  The default username is admin with a blank password (thispart is not in that stupid printed manual that came in the box withthe camera..but luckily you threw it in the trash.)Step 4: This is important: save yourself some grief and use InternetExplorer to get this thing setup. You can play around with Firefox andother browsers all you want later, but for sake of simplicity, justuse IE for now.  Since you're using IE you'd use the first set oflogin parameters on the login page.Step 5: Now that you are logged in, you should see an Active X requestso go ahead and right click and install it.  Then you may need to runan additional app that pops up before you can see the video stream.Step 6: Hey wow!  There you are in the video if  you've got it pointedat yourself.  So far so good. I played around a bit at this point,panning the camera left, right, up, down..pretty nice! Cut out thelights...yep..can still see me in the dark...except now I've got bigdevilish pupils.  Now you need to configure all of the settings underadministrator (on the bottom left of the screen).You need to decide how you will get to the camera over the Internet.I've got a DynDNS account, but it's a whole lot more easy to just useport forwarding on my router.  So I picked an available port, gave itsome random name, and pointed that port to the fixed IP of the camera. You'll also need to be sure you get all of your settings deadaccurate correct, otherwise your wireless won't work.  Make sure yourSSID is correct, your Auth Key is correct, Encryption type, etc. etc.If just one thing is wrong, you won't be able to go wireless.  Forcertain settings in your camera, it may need to reboot thecamera..kind of annoying but it is what it is.  Once you get all ofyour wireless settings correct, you can remove the network cable fromthe back of the camera.  Your camera should still show up in the IPCamera Tool window.  If not, you did something wrong.  If so,  you'renow ready to go wireless.  To test, I used:[...] :AssignedPortIUsed  Works great!Regarding the email: because of the poor use of English, when you areputting in SMTP server account settings (if you chose to have it emailyou pictures when motion trips the alarm) then BE SURE YOU CLICKSUBMIT AFTER YOU ENTER ALL OF THE INFORMATION AND BEFORE BEFORE BEFORE**BEFORE** YOU CLICK ON "TEST".  The camera will not take the settingsuntil you click on SUBMIT.  So make sure you SUBMIT before you TEST.I got hung up on this for about 30 minutes of KNOWING my settings werecorrect, but couldn't figure out why the camera said it couldn'tconnect to my account. I even did the whole Telnet routine to connectmanually to the SMTP port because I knew my settings were correct.CLICK SUBMIT BEFORE YOU TEST.Regarding the motion alarm: I used the scheduling for the motion alarmto trip when I'm at work...so I put in my work schedule. No one shouldbe walking around inside my home while I'm not there. If they do, I'vegot them on video straight to my cell phone, in which case I'dpromptly call the police.Well, that's about it for me.  It works great.  Also, as one of thereceiving email accounts, I wanted to mention that you can use youremail to text with your cell phone company (I have tmobile, so it's[...] ) so now when the motion is trippedon your camera, it will send the pictures via SMS text to your cellphone.  I can't say enough good things about this camera. I just hopeit stands the test of time..and maybe I'll come back and do a followup review in a few months.Have fun! Merry Christmas!

Reviews.Title: Basic IP camera, poor low light performance
Reviews.Author: R. Hilton

The camera does well in daylight and serves images over its web server around 30 FPS at 320 x 240 resolution.However, at night, the camera turns on its IR LEDS, this apparently draws a lot of power and the camera's frame rate drops to only 7 FPS.For simple monitoring of your home while you are away, it is easy to setup and use, the web server includes buttons to turn the camera left/right and up/down and to make small adjustment to brightness and contrast.The customer image that is labeled "Kitchen - 2010-07-08 01:24:48" is an image capture during the night where a cat jumped onto my kitchen island. It's hard to tell it's a cat from the single frame. This camera may not be that useful as a security camera because the quality of the images, especially in darkness, is poor.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Stephen L. Ambruzs "Way, Way Up Here"
Reviews.Content: Pros: good picture quality, virtually noise-free operation, great night vision, easy network connectivity, excellent A+ tech support.Cons: A bit large and obtrusive, software is buggy, power cord a bit too short.Overall I'm very pleased with my purchase.  I bought this camera primarily for use as a security system, but also as a gag so my wife and I could watch our cat during the day while we are at work (pathetic, I know).  The email motion alarm and FTP file storage allow for us to instantly know (and save the pictures to a remote location) if someone breaks into our house.  The camera software is a bit buggy, it doesn't work 100% using firefox (i get strange errors when trying to pan) and the email settings need to be re-worked in order to allow you to enter more characters in certain fields.  I'd imagine these will be fixed during the next firmware or browser software update.  That being said I can easily log on anywhere I have an internet connection and check on my house, day or night.  I also wish the power cord was a bit longer so I don't have to use an extension cord.  Tech support was great, what every company should strive for.  I emailed them with a question and received continuous help over the next few days until the issue was resolved.

Reviews.Title: NOT AN AUTHENTIC FOSCAM!
Reviews.Author: Amy T. Perry "wishful thinker"
Reviews.Content: I got my shipment today. Guess what? This model is a Chinese knock-off. Mac-compatible? Don't think so, buckaroo. The "Quick Installation Guide" CD loads as CrossOver, which my computer does not recognize (the CD is probably bootlegged as well). Since CrossOver had the only U.S. tech support number, I called them in Minnesota. The poor service rep was disgusted with the seller's lack of principles. Adding insult to injury, I discovered too late that Foscam's website actually warns potential buyers that Amazon and eBay are selling these fakes; therefore, they are no longer offering free tech support to customers who buy them.I trusted Amazon to sell me a Foscam F18908W, not a POS from Guangdong. Shame, shame, shame!

Reviews.Title: CHINESE KNOCKOFF
Reviews.Author: hctibatuc
Reviews.Content: I received a counterfeit Foscam IP camera from a Fulfillment-by-Amazon seller. Why on earth are they making knockoffs of these anyway?Don't buy from resellers: Foscam's official website even warns that counterfeits are available on Amazon.Here is how to tell whether your camera is genuine or fake: [...]

Reviews.Title: Returned this item
Reviews.Author: JoeFargo
Reviews.Content: This cam worked fine indoors, but I wanted to have it pointed outside through a window.  All I could get was a white screen.  The bright outdoor scenes completely overwhelmed the sensor.  It works fine for indoor scenes, but unless it is a REALLY cloudy day or near dusk or dawn, it is unusable for outdoor scenes.  At night, the led lights would reflect off the window glass back into the sensor, and again, overwhelm it.It did not fit my requirements at all and I returned it for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality, difficult to set-up, didn't last
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This product is terrible on every level.  It took me hours to set it up to where it was usable.  You have to reboot it after almost every change.  The manual is almost useless.  I got more help reading about the camera on-line than I did from the manual.  I wanted the camera to monitor an area and email pictures to me if motion was detected.  The camera was always about 3 seconds behind the detected motion, so all I got was the either a picture with nothing but background or a picture of a person's back walking away from the camera.  After a week, the camera would quit working after it was on for more than 8 hours and I would have to unplug it, wait 5 minutes and plug it back in.  2 weeks after that it quit working all together.  Now I have to figure out how to send it back.

Reviews.Title: cheaper than the panasonic
Reviews.Author: Path To Wisdom
Reviews.Content: I won't give it 5 stars because the image has "curves" or bends,seems like a bad lens.I finally got it working in wireless mode. Here's the secret.Instruction "unplug, and plug back in for 30 seconds" is wrong.It is about 120 seconds before my computer "sees" the camera.  And the instruction on UPnP needs to be changed. Just click "enable" on both the camera, and the wireless router, then ignore the "in conflict" message. So don't look for the "UPnP success" message. Also, needs to remove the firewall on the wireless router , and the wireless router needs to be re-booted from the computer. Of course, set up the WEP security.I discovered my Belkin wireless router kicks out / disconnects the camera.And I have to reboot the router for the camera to work/be recognized.I set my camera's port to 50010, ip address to xxx.xxx.x.100 andin the router, the virtual mapping - in port (from outside) at 8080, internal/private port to 50010.Have to set up the Dyndns account.May not be able to access this at work because the camera requires your computer to install a file, which my employer's IT guys would block. But at least you can save a snapshot and see the place. Don't know if the "panning" is locked if the access is blocked.

Reviews.Title: 2 of 3 cameras died within 1 day
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these as a test having been burned by IP cameras before.  I was very happy with my first order, the camera worked and was easy to setup even without Windows (I just plugged it in and let it DHCP an address off my router and then went to that IP with a browser and did the rest of the setup in the web GUI).  The night vision works well enough for a $120 camera and there is an iPhone app to view/pan/tilt the camera and that worked with minimal config on my end (just changed the web port on the camera and set my router to forward that port to the camera IP).  Seemed like a great deal based on the first one so I bought 2 more of them.Of the second shipment, one kept crashing/locking up/basically required a power-cycle every few hours.  Useless.  The other ended up with washed-out video as if the iris stuck full open after the first day.  It worked in pitch black conditions with the night vision but with normal lighting in the room the image was mostly white and in bright daylight the image was completely white.  No amount of tweaking the software or resetting the hardware would get it functional again.  I'm sending both of these back.So... if you get lucky you get a functional unit.  If you're unlucky you get garbage.  Worth the risk to you?

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: owookiee "owookiee"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these to keep an eye on the dog/house while we're gone.  I chose this one because of the relative price.  Overall I'm very pleased.Pros:-Setup of wireless authentication type and password was smooth (plug it in to the network directly the first time though), setup of alarm mail sending also easy.  I have a port forwarding entry in my router for the camera, and my router already updates its IP address to Dyndns, so accessing the camera remotely was also quick to setup.-pan/tilt works pretty well through the web interface.-nightvision is awesome, and the infrared leds, though noticeable, are much less so than on other cameras I've seen.Some cons:-audio is only usable through the IE/activex page, not the plain firefox page-motion detection sensitivity level doesn't work well - at 10 you get notified for everything, but then at 5,8,9 I've walked across the room and it doesn't pick it up, so I end up leaving it at 10 and delete a lot of the notificition emails-it's taking screencaps from a movie basically, so often the snapshots the alarm sends you are blurred, depending on how fast the person was walking through the room-whitebalance detection could be better, the walls in its room are painted red and that affects the hues of all the colors viewed through the camera.-software on the camera has crashed or locked up twice a month, requiring you to physically unplug and replug in the camera to reset it-ignored my setting of "do not flash the bright green light" on the front bottom, so I have electrical tape over it.-pan/tilt makes a noticeable whirring sound, alerting people they're being watchedOverall this tends to be the cheapest camera in this class on Amazon, and I find it worth the price.

Reviews.Title: A total Horror show
Reviews.Author: B. Smith
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this product. After purchasing two of these, one was dead right out of the box and the second wouldn't connect to my network. Customer support wouldn't help and after one call, wouldn't return my calls or emails. Save yourself the headache and keep looking past foSCAM

Reviews.Title: Fakes. Poor Camera. Fails in 3 months
Reviews.Author: R. Poulton
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera and it failed 3 months later. Attempted to warranty it through manufacturer and they informed me it was a fake. Attempted to warranty it through Amazon and they will have nothing to do with it.While the camera worked, it worked well. Wireless was solid, but only opperated on our N while the network was reduced to G speeds (we have a dual wireless network N/G). So all wireless was reduced to 54mps.I'm disappointed in both product quality, getting a fake from Amazon is brutal. And I'm disappointed that Amazon won't make it right. I bought a second one to replace failed one and received a until that looked very different than the first purchase. Yet, another fake. Sending it back to Amazon.Brutal product, poor life expectancy and bad customer service. Next cam will be purchased direct.FYI those having problems with connection, it's a user issue. Both cameras have been online in about 5 minutes. Simplest IP cams I've had to setup.

Reviews.Title: Grey market, not supported by FOSCAM
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Katz "WangDang"
Reviews.Content: In terms of the technical aspects, the other reviews sum it up well.  However, if you were to contact Foscam to get help on this product, you will meet a stone wall of refusal.Apparently there are only two authorized sellers of Foscam products: Foscam US and their ebay outlet.  Apparently every single Amazon seller of Foscam products is selling either grey market or counterfeit items, according to Foscam.  Foscam will only provide support, either for their hardware or their software, if you purchase from them directly.  This unit on their site runs $110 or $149, depending on whether you get the old or new version of it.You can identify the newer version because it does not have the green LED at the 6 PM position on the face.  This is the older version here.  You can read on the differences between the -08(old) and the -18 versions on the Foscam site, but they relate to effectiveness of the IR beams, quality of motion detection, and location of some of the lights, LEDs and lack of PIN settings.Now, assuming you purchased from Foscam directly, if you go to the Foscam forums you will learn that their newer model, the -18W model, has a problem with the audio so bad that you have to open the unit and remove and re-solder on a new resistor to fix it.  Further, if you want to send it back to them, they'll charge you shipping.  This is not what I wanted to read on the Foscam forums.I cannot recommend these cameras from Foscam as a result, even though they do provide good images at a cheap price . . . but only if you are technically adept at troubleshooting the software interface which is still pretty rough (for example, the radio buttons don't show if they are 'on' or 'off' for most of them, you just have to guess).

Reviews.Title: Great wired, will not connect wireless
Reviews.Author: Cindy Trubovitz
Reviews.Content: It works great with a cable, but will not function wirelessly. Tech support is very nice and really tried to help, but it just doesn't work without cable or needs a true network expert,  just beyond an average  home network person.

Reviews.Title: Great Cam for the Price
Reviews.Author: jradam1
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical about purchasing this camera after reading the reviews.  But most of the negative reviews were based on wireless connectivity issues and the manual translation.  I know just enough about networking to be dangerous - trial and error is my main method of accomplishing anything when it comes to working on my home network.  I bought two cameras, the first one took me about 3 hours to figure out.  The manual is translated to English by a NON-native or NON-fluent English speaker, however, it is close enough that I could figure out what they were meaning.  I did have to set up port forwarding on my router.  This was one of the tricky parts for me.  The initial set up is done with the camera hard wired to the router.  Then you enter in the wireless settings and it reboots and comes back up (after removing the hard wire during the boot up process) trying to connect on the wireless settings.  Well I had my port forwarding set up to the assigned IP address of the camera for the hard wired connection.  When it comes up using the wireless connection, it is assigned a different IP.  Once I figured this out, I had not issues with my wireless connectivity.  I set the second camera up in about 15 minutes.  The picture quality is acceptable (for me) for the purpose I am using the camera for - I just need to be able to see what is going on.  The colors are not true to life but I am not using the camera to make photo memories, or home videos.  I am pleasantly surprised with the performance so far - I have been using it for about two weeks.

Reviews.Title: Don't waist your money
Reviews.Author: G. Smallwood "GMS"
Reviews.Content: This is a copy of the letter I sent to Foscam and did not get an answer.This is a poor waist of your money don't waist your time or money get anything else but one of these.I have a Foscam FI8908W and a FI8904W neither one of them will work. I had the FI8908W working OK then all of a sudden the wireless quit working and it can no longer communicate wireless.  I upgraded the firmware but that did not work I am using Firmware 11.4.2.17 and web UI 2.4.8.14 and the camera works fine connected to the router  via Ethernet Cat 5 it just won't work wirelessly.  It does not detect a network when I scan for it through the set-up software.  I can't detect the camera when I scan for wireless devices.  I was using Firmware 11.14.1.46 which was original version.  It worked fine for about 3 months and then just quit working.  All of my other wireless cameras are working fine but they are Linksys.  I have also tried changing antennas with the FI8904W that didn't work either.The FI8904W is an indoor outdoor but it does not work outside because there is too much light.  I  have it in the shade but it still is too bright.  I have even used a black 12 inch (30 cm)  PVC pipe to make limit the light and that still does not work.  I can't turn down the brightness or contrast enough to really see anything.  It seems to work ok inside or at night just not outside during the daytime.I have not had very good luck with Foscam so far I hope these are problems that are easy to fix and the product is just an example of German precision.  I hope it is not poor design and a bad product.

Reviews.Title: IP cam
Reviews.Author: Benny L. West
Reviews.Content: Good product and a good price. Once you understand a little about port forwarding it is easy to set up....

Reviews.Title: Much better than expected
Reviews.Author: Jules Hoehn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of its comparability with Zoneminder. Zoneminder provided me with some more advanced features than the stock firmware. However, the stock firmware is much better than expected. the 640x480 resolution worried me alittle, but i can see clearly enough to identify people in my environment. the night vision is FANTASTIC! i can see further and clearer on this $75 IP camera than my $300 sony handycam with night vision. I have to say, for the price it is fantastic. the machine is completely silent when it pans and tilts. the mic and speaker are sub par, but video recording is the only reason im getting it. you can listen and talk through it, but expect to only have a conversation with someone really close to the camera, and the mic/speaker array causes a bit of feedback and noise when talking through it. the wall mount is great, the material "rubberized plastic" feels great and its a bit heavier than i anticipated. with WIFI and LAN NICs the device can be places almost anywhere. I wish it has some onboard storage or it could record mp4s to a shared drive on a server. FTP support is not all that great, it seems to just save frames. if you run it in IE with active x the stream can be record WITH SOUND to the local machine in a designated folder in a mp4 format. I really like that feature but i dont want to have another desktop machine running all the time. server integration would be the best. but, its only a $75 ip camera. something slightly frustrating is the onboard motion detection. It it a bit tricky to tune right, and you cant set an area to monitor. and it seems like motion detect doesn't work while panning. (that would be cool but understandably not supported). motion detect trips an alarm event, that can be scheduled. scheduler seems buggy but works. after motion even camera records for 1 minute, not just until object leaves frame. Noes not record previous or buffered frames before alarm. but all of these issues are remedied with Zoneminder. all in all, awesome hard ware for $75. i dont think anyone looking for a decent IP camera would be disappointed with this one. glad i got one, looking at getting some more FOSCAM stuff.I will post some more videos and setup details about it in the near future at T3CHKOMMIE.com

Reviews.Title: Great Value for the Money
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I have a lot of gripes about this camera, but I do believe it is worth every penny.  1. You need to purchase a license for Blue Iris to overcome the build-in software limitations.  The built in motion trigger is not fast enough, and you'll miss the action.  Blue Iris solves that problem.  You get a trial copy with the camera.  2. The color is terrible; it might as well be black and white.  3. The night vision works well indoors, but if you put it in the window, you will not be able to see out the window at night due to the light reflecting back off the glass.  4. After a power loss or reboot, the camera looks up, and you have to re-adjust it.  5. You have to use Microsoft Internet Explorer to get full features.  6. There's no zoom, and faces look grainy from a distance, and forget about reading license plates.  7. It's big, so you'll need a decent ledge space to set it on, or you'll have to mount it.  Despite my gripes, I think it is well made, and it does what I need it to do.  I can view in to my home remotely from work and look left, right, up, and down.  It's not bad.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money, but somewhat painful
Reviews.Author: Ben_dover "all good in the end"
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived in typical fast paced Amazon fashion and was packaged very nicely by Foscam.The instructions are pretty much (but not totally) useless.I used the instruction manual to initially setup the camera. I then had to use Google and the instructions (had to use google to interpret manual because English is that bad) that came with the camera for the rest of the setup. I really could not set this up without the talk forums from the net. Honestly with the knowledge I have with computers setting it up wired 1st, then wireless was not a problem for me. It was setting up e-mail forwarding, i.e. the camera has motion sensors (that work very well btw)that will take snapshots and send them via e-mail. Well, this is where the fun began.....in the instructions manual, don't even bother...just go straight to the web and search for instructions. I typed in "set-up e-mail for foscam" and I found a gentleman in a foscam-help-forum that helped me more then foscam's manual did. As a matter of fact after reading his instructions I had this stage done in seconds! I am so happy I made the dummy account from aol due to the fact that if my cat walks by the cam it takes 6 pictures, 1 every second and sends an e-mail to me. Well, with a cat walking back and forth or playing around I got like 42 e-mails in about 10 minutes. So I advise even if you use aol to setup another dummy account for this if you do not want your regular e-mail acct to get clotted with pix of your house. ;)Here is the link to the security e-mail function post in the forum so you can have it if you want it....WHICH YOU WILL WANT IT!!![…]PRO'sPrice is right! $$$$Video quality is better then I had expected.Night-vision mode is better then I expected. A bit of lag when using this though.Almost real-time (1 sec lag) wireless communication.Comes with mounting brackets and screws, and usb cord!!! WOW!So all in all, it IS a really nice piece of hardware, so nice that I picked up a 2nd.CON'SInstruction manual is pretty much a joke...written by someone that does not know how to speak English. I wondered if it were someone from China using a google translator to write this manual out before shipping it...really it is that bad.Installation is NOT a breeze, at least not by today's standards. Once I went through the pain of setting up cam 1, # 2 was a breeze though....I would not recommend this for someone NOT that computer savvy.A bit more lag when using night-vision.And lastly; NO ZOOM FUNCTION.This product would have gotten 5 stars from me if not for the sloppy, broken-non-English language used.

Reviews.Title: Great solid camera, great night vision!
Reviews.Author: Fabian
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a cheap wifi ip camera with night vision.I came up with this Foscam camera and others a lot more expensive like Panasonic or Trendnet cameras.I'm happy I decided to buy this one!!A friend bought the Panasonic camera for over $250 and I must say that the quality of the video is the same.BUT Panasonic does not have IR Night Vision.. Night vision in Foscam camera is just awesome!You have to know a little about your router and DynDns services if you want to check the camera via internet.The user manual is poor.Panasonic camera offers a service where you sign up, choose a URL and that's it.. their software does the tech stuff at your router and you're online in a few minutes. That's the advantage for non-tech people.Becareful of Foscam replicas!Do not buy a Foscam camera for less than $100 ... it's probably not the original.Solid piece of hardware, pan, tilt, clear color view, b/w clear night vision, two-way audio, record on demand, record on motion, wifi, roof/wall base ... the software is not very nice but does the work and supports several cameras.There's also a paid application for the iphone ($5 I think)I recommed this item and I would definitly but it again!NOTE: For those with problems finding the audio and record controls, they are only available if you use IE and install the activeX, it's not available for other browsers.NOTE 2: If you can not set the record target folder or you can not record at all and you're on Windows 7, you have to start IE as administrator (Run as Administrator) and those features will be enabled.

Reviews.Title: Be careful which source you buy it from
Reviews.Author: Michael A Barkett
Reviews.Content: If it looks too good to be true, then it is!  I got mine from "VALUELINK SUPPLIES" and like many other suppliers, they offered it at about half the maximum price shown in the consolidated results.The device looks a bit different than the one in the Amazon picture, but is very close.  Giving them the benefit of the doubt, I want to believe it is an OEM of the real thing, especially since FOSCAM itself appears to be a Chinese company which would explain the broken English in the instruction manual.However, many attributes of this device lead me to believe that it is merely a lookalike.  After a couple hours with it, here are my notes.Pros:1. It works, for the most part.2. The mobile phone app is an awesome feature - very cool!3. Decent quality images, fairly flexible features for remote surveillance at a very good price.4. Night vision is pretty cool.Cons:1. No SSL support.  I hate this shortcoming and because of it I would never use this camera in a secured area.2. Neither WPA nor WPA2 works properly, though it claims to support it.  If you're lucky they'll work, but more likely you will have to switch to WEP or Open, neither of which are secure.  Fortunately for me there is nothing else on this particular wifi network, although any savvy hacker driving by can get a view from my camera.  Another reason not to point it at anything you can't already see through a window.3. Makes a loud clicking noise randomly - I think this is a byproduct of a more serious deficiency, which is that the power cable is shoddy, doesn't stay connected very well.4. Reset button does not reset to factory settings.5. Network label panel on the back is just a sticker that came off within 5 minutes.  No biggie, but indicative of cheapness.6. This is the most suspicious trait.  At the end of the manual it says, "to obtain the latest information and support for your Observer network camera, please visit our webpage for additional FAQ's and troubleshooting tips," yet there is no link to a webpage to be found anywhere in the docs except on the outer box, which says [...].  None of the model numbers on foscam.com match up with the model numbers printed on the documentation.7. The included software is garbage, although the web interface is serviceable.8. Lackluster Firefox support.9. No idea whether my credentials in the mobile phone app are being kept private to me, or if a bunch of other people might have access to my cam.  This is where SSL with client cert would provide more peace of mind.10. No ability to restrict certain user accounts by IP address.  Strike three on security.  Ok for keeping an eye on your pets or front door maybe, but not the interior of your house or business.I haven't tested the motion sensor alerts yet.I will point out that I gave it 3 stars because it works pretty much as advertised (except as noted above) and the Foscam firmware did install on it properly.  However, those are 3 very sketchy stars.

Reviews.Title: Great little indoor camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew Coile
Reviews.Content: I was going out of town on a series of business trips, and wanted to be able to keep an eye on my apartment while I was away (before I got an alarm system installed).  I read good reviews of this camera, and bought one.This camera is great, especially after upgrading to the latest firmware.  Great support for non-IE browsers (I'm a Mac user), and works well under Safari on the iPhone, but there is also at least one really good iPhone app that lets you do the Pan-Tilt by pressing on the image, and display up to six cameras in a grid.No problem connecting to my wireless network, and I haven't had any problems with drops or freezes.  Tested out the Motion Sensing software, and it worked perfectly....if it detects motion, it sends a series of captures to my email.  The Schedule option lets me suppress them during the times I'm normally home.I liked the first one so much, I immediately bought two more, and one of the outside cousins (that does *not* have pan-tilt) to monitor the rest of my apartment.It's amazing the peace of mind you get on trips from being able to pull out your iPhone and look at all areas of your home.Great little cameras, and the people at eWorld that I got mine from great to deal with, and incredibly fast on shipping.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the money
Reviews.Author: Fani
Reviews.Content: Pros -+ simple setup. Works with Firefox and in Linux ( after some tweaking with Zoneminder ) and Mac and iPhone !!!+ works well. You can Pan Tilt Zoom remotely. Picture quality is acceptable.+ night vision works well.+ contrast/brightness changes appropriately when switching from indoor view to outdoor view+ nice and compact+ can email/ftp when motion sensor is tripped AND can report via email when your external IP changes !!+ has great range of motion 270 degrees Pan and 120 degrees of Tilt. More than adequate to cover a large range+ can push it in continuous pan/tilt mode which swivel scanning. great for easily expanding your range when you place it at corner of your house+ wireless !! Yay !+ price is reasonable+ (I've heard) great customer supportCons -- Linux support missing audio- Windows/IE ActiveX needed for full features with sound.- Picture quality can be better in these days. Should've come with like 2MP camera or even 3.2 MP camera. 2MP and 3MP cameras are cheap now and offer enough resolution to identify faces clearly- does not have good motion sensor detection. At 10, it detects up to 15 feet, at 5, its almost nothing- does not capture video when motion sensor is tripped. Ideally it should record a 30sec video clip and upload that instead of snapping away blurry pictures- motion detector resolution is slightly low. Did not catch me back my car out of the driveway. Should've. But I was approx. 45 feet away so its perhaps beyond the range of this product.- Network blinking light couldn't be turned off from the web. I had to search on Bing and find a solution to shut it offOverall, I would wholeheartedly recommend this product. For this price range, it cannot get any better than this. I would rate this overall an 8/10 since most of my negative points apply to almost every other device in this category.

Reviews.Title: Great product! Love the camera.
Reviews.Author: Tyler Worman
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to setup when I'm away. It works great and setup was fairly easy! Note that you will receive the newer FI8918W (without the relay/mosfet) if you order it at this point. If you need the relay, you will need to find a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, does the job.
Reviews.Author: Scotch and Robusto's
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that I have some computer experience, but fairly limited.  I'm an amateur tinkerer with no formal training.It took me about 5 hours to set this up the first time, as I had no idea how to forward a port on my modem, etc.  We moved and it took me about 15 minutes the second time, so it's not terrible once you get through it.The Pros: The camera works great.  There are several iphone apps which let me control it while I'm out and about.  The night vision works fairly well too.  It's only IR source are the red LED's that ring the lens, so the reach is only about 12 feet of clear IR vision.  Still, that's enough to see the front door and monitor the living room, which is good enough for me.The Cons: Structurally, the camera seems to emit a high frequency whine which can be very irritating, but is not omnidirectional.  Basically, if I turn the camera up toward the ceiling, I can't hear it anymore.  This can be annoying while sitting and watching tv, but since I don't need to watch myself watch tv, it's functional.  My remaining issues are likely related to my own lack of expertise, but I can't get the two way microphone to work.  Also, I have been completely unable to set up an email alert for the motion sensor.  I don't know what I need to do, and I have pretty much given up there.  I think that the problem is that I don't have an email account that will allow the camera to access its SMTP/SSL or something.Anyway, for what I paid, I'm happy with it.  Some day, when I have more scratch, I'll upgrade to one of those plug and play out of the box rigs.  But for now, I like the piece of mind that I can check in whenever I want.

Reviews.Title: It's a start
Reviews.Author: gemniii
Reviews.Content: Pro'sOther than power it's wireless.Good resolutionNight vision works fine for me (watch the puppy when all the lights are out)Fairly straightforward setup if you read comments on the net firstSoftware that came with it worked well, easy to pan and tilt the camera.ConsNot wireless NFor an inexpensive solution this worked out great.There's a bunch of freeware and low cost camera software for it which allows recording etc.I've been using one for but 6 months, no major problem.  Was about to buy another but it seems they are introducing a wireless N model soon. I like being able to easily move it from room to room, only worrying about electrical power.I was wary about all the reported problems in setting it up, but it was easy.  However I've been working and wiring networks since the 1980's.

Reviews.Title: Hardware fine, documentation is awful
Reviews.Author: Donald H Rosenthal
Reviews.Content: Like many, I bought this camera for home security when I am away from my home--perhaps months at a time. The printed manual on paper is pathetic--use the manual on the CD to understand what is going on. I am a typical computer user with, perhaps, more patience than most for trying to figure out technical details. I tried. Bottom line: without the help of my son (computer science major), I likely would not have gotten the thing running properly. I was able to see the camera inside my network, but could not deal with the port forwarding and dynamic IP issues that needed to be addressed to access the camera from the internet. It is hard to fault the camera itself for this, but better documentation would be great.Once the camera is hooked up and you can access it, the settings are well explained in the manual on the CD. Once you solve the basic networking issues, the rest of the features are easy to configure. A few tips I learned.- Camera can automatically e-mail you when its IP address changes (most likely due to a new dynamic IP address being assigned from your ISP).- Camera is specifically enabled to work with Hotmail. If you give the camera an account and you have an account, you can "chat" with it via Messenger (Messenger,which is associated with Hotmail, must be installed on your PC). If you send the chat message, "url?" the camera responds with its current full IP address. So, if you want to see the camera from a remote location, chat with it and then use the IP address it gives you to access the camera.- For some reason, I was able to see the live video feed from my iPad without giving a password. I don't get this. Perhaps safari in the iPad stored the password. The same does not occur with my regular MAC and safari.- When you do enter the password, my browser indicates is is being sent "unencrypted." Potential issue?- A temperature sensor built into the camera would be a good addition.I need several cameras and will buy a CISCO camera and try it. My primary reasons for trying another brand: 1) poor documentation; and 2) potential security issues--I want to stress that I do not know whether there is an issue.

Reviews.Title: Its ok as long as its 12 inches from the router
Reviews.Author: Catheryne
Reviews.Content: First the camera can't be very far from the router.  So now I have had to order an extender antenna.  Also the setup for wireless was so difficult I spent $70 for tech support and it took them 2 hours to get it working.  Yes,the video is good, but it should be for the price of the camera, the extra antenna and 2 hours of tech support.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera! --- (Not Really - review is revised - no stars)
Reviews.Author: chuckbobuck
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time trying to decide if I should buy the camera based on reviews. Some users had a hard time figuring it out. Others said the instructions were unclear. Some didn't like the image quality. All I can say is that it only took me about an hour to set it up. That is mainly because it just takes that long to get set up and do anything. When the controller software asked for User and Password I didn't read the instructions. You are supposed to type "admin" for the user and leave the password blank. For wireless operation you will need to know your router ID and password. Not too bad. You need to know that when you install any wireless device with a router. The rest is a breeze. It works perfectly. The quality is beyond what I expected, especially for the price. The motors are quiet and the operation is smooth. The resolution is 640x480 (low but good). That's how it's designed, so why all of the user complaints? If you go to another computer and type the IP address of the camera into the browser you are prompted to run an activeX controller that gives you control of the camera remotely. Nice! I like this camera and wish I had bought a couple more. It was easy to install and it's easy to use.Additional Comments:When I went out of range of my router I found that a whole new set of problems occur. The software stops working. You need to do port forwarding or have the IP address managed by a host site since the IP address of the router isn't static. I got it setup through a host and it lasted about 2 weeks. The camera went off line or maybe it went rogue, but I can't find it. I don't want to set it up every 2 weeks, so mine will become part of the landfill. Check out the Dropcam instead.

Reviews.Title: I wouldn't buy another
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: The original unit worked well for about 2 weeks and then the automatic exposure control didn't function.  The Foscam website was of little help, but said be wary of counterfeit units on Amazon.  I contacted the distributer who shipped the unit, and it was exchanged very rapidly.  The replacement unit was obviously not new nor was it re-certified.  It came with someone else's alias and password and the cables and other parts were all unwrapped from their original.  The only way to get around this was a total master reset with paper clip.  If the distributer had verified the operation, it would have been left with the default password.The automatic exposure control works on this one, but the colors are very messed up.  Green grass which was green on the first camera is a washed out brown color.  The manual which came with the unit is a basic quick start.

Reviews.Title: It Works
Reviews.Author: Derek
Reviews.Content: I purchased this cam to use a baby monitor. The setup went OK. I used wired to setup and wireless to use. The router did not like it but the camera setup was fine.With port forwarding on router accessing from web is easy. I changed the port for security and my biggest trouble is remembering to type in the port when accessing outside of the house.The controls are easy to use. It does not have audio available in any browser other than IE. This would be my biggest complaint. I use an iPod Touch also to access and the two apps I have used work great with NO audio.Limited audio use is the only con I have found. Decent for the price. Easy enough to setup. Nice picture.I also used the FTP service to see what my daughter did in the middle of the night. Taking a snapshot every 5 min or so. I found out she is a very restless sleeper and two nights she woke up a couple times and wriggled around and looked at and smiled at the camera. My daughter is 4 with CP and can not get out of bed on her own or roll over. The peace of mind is great. Now I go to bed late because I watch her fall asleep.If you read this far, the summary... Buy it.

Reviews.Title: cheap, but cheap
Reviews.Author: G. Jeronowitz
Reviews.Content: Wow the price was low and the software and video quality match.The box and advertising are misleading; while the camera does in fact have two way audio capability, you can't use it unless you use Internet Explorer as the audio functions require ActiveX. This means myself as a Mac user paid for an advertised feature that I can not use.The camera pan/tilt motors are very quiet, I think you'd have to be in an specifically silenced room to hear the motors running at anything more than arms length. The IR LEDs do a commendable job of illuminating out to the advertised range.The firmware on the camera is awkward but simple enough to figure out. The most annoying part is that the camera has to reboot after every setting change and that process takes from 1 to 5 minutes depending on if you've enabled the "center camera on power on" function (actually, it's enabled by default).I think this camera is going back.

Reviews.Title: No Auto Exposure control
Reviews.Author: Bahi. A
Reviews.Content: This camera does not have auto exposure feature. We need to adjust the brightness manually which really sucks. Good exposure for night becoming over exposure for mid day. They really need to add this feature. Otherwise its useless. I sent an email to their support and never got response. No customer support. I will be returning this camera.

Reviews.Title: not what I expected
Reviews.Author: C. Tucker
Reviews.Content: I read reviews of how difficult installing this camera was, but assumed since I worked in the IT field that I wouldn't have any issues.  Well I was wrong...  The instructions are very difficult to follow, are not clear in what order to do things, and it feels as though it was originally written in a different language and was poorly translated.  With that said (and downloading the user manual of the foscam website) I was finally able to setup this camera.  The image quality seems decent and the 360 panning control is pretty cool.  The web user interface leaves a lot to be desired, but it's manageable.  I primarily bought this to view the camera from my iPhone as indicated in the description, but all that means is you are able to pull up the exact same web interface in safari.  So if you want to see a 2x2 image, then they are correct that it supports viewing on the iPhone.  In terms of the two way audio, it requires you to plug the camera into a microphone and speaker system which seems somewhat deceptive.  Other than that I think the unit itself is well made hardware.  Maybe they will release an updated firmware version soon to improve the web interface, at that point I would be more willing to recommend.

Reviews.Title: lousy camera
Reviews.Author: M. G. davis "skip davis"
Reviews.Content: i have two dlink cameras that are much better.  video is poor, ir is useless, setup not intuitive, but functional.  not a good value.

Reviews.Title: Nice price, but poor features
Reviews.Author: Jon B
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of expensive IP cameras on the market, so it's nice to see something so affordable. However, the features leave a lot to be desired. Here are my issues:- When your WiFi access point or router goes down, you have to power cycle the camera.- The web interface is pretty funky, and was clearly written by a non-native English speaker.- The night vision is inadequate. I installed one of these in my basement, and it's basically useless at night.- Color accuracy is terrible.- Motion alarms are useless since you can't mask part of the image.

Reviews.Title: Great Value !
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveler
Reviews.Content: Received this product today -- arrived pretty fast. Had it setup in about 15 minutes. mini-cd came with it had the manual and software on it. Loaded the software - it found the camera on my network quickly. Dbl click on the device and it opens the webpage to logon to the camera. Id= admin - no pwd - camera works! wow that was easy - not the problems others seem to have. I had it look for my wireless network, it found it -- gave it the password -- and walaa - on wireless. I pulled the pwr plug on the camera, pulled the ethernet conneciton out, plugged it back in to pwr and within minutes it was on the network again. I logged and and setup the dyndns.org id and pwd I had created, open port fwd on linksys router to this ip and within another 10 min was hitting it from the internet.I might have a newer firmware or something -- but for the price you can't beat the value - now all I need is zoom !

Reviews.Title: My Apology to IPCam CENTRAL
Reviews.Author: M. Jefferson
Reviews.Content: I felt I needed to add this review due to a somewhat bad review I posted the first time around. My fault and I feel very bad for the review. First off the camera is great,instruction manual a little confusing. Second, the ship and delivery was fast and ontime. Third and most important, I contacted the seller by email asking for some support on installing it and stated in my review that they never replied.They have tried to contact me many times, but found my phone number with Amazon was wrong, again my fault. It seems that once I had my number changed,my contact number on my profile with amazon I failed to update. IPCam Central was one of the best sellers I have delt with and I hope to do more buying from them. If there were any way possible I would definately change my rating to 10 stars for this seller.My apologies to the team of IPCam Central.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but lousy software
Reviews.Author: MK
Reviews.Content: I think the camera is amazing, but getting it working on WiFi isn't trivial.  In my particular case, the camera's firmware is actually broken and does not fully support the WPA spec.  If you have certain "special" characters in your key, it will not work.  There is a post about this on their site but no fix in site.[...]Anyway, the camera is awesome except I bought it specifically for its wireless abilities.  I hope to update this review in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great Cam - Wireless works fine
Reviews.Author: Zoso67
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.The setup was a bit tricky on the wireless but once I figured out what was wrong it worked like a champ.My network uses WPA encryption which this camera does support.  Just make sure you don't have more than 8 characters in the key for your wireless network.  I had to change mine in order for it to connect to WPA.Night vision is fine, works about 10-15ft.Audio is crappy but could work better with firmware updates.  Except for the speaker on the unit itself, total crap.  But the mic works and you can hear outdoor audio just fine.Recording video works fine, motion detection works fine but has a sweet spot you have to find.  The ability to automatically record motion triggered video is a really nice feature.  Records a 2min video every time motion is detected.All in all a great Wifi ip cam for the price.The iPhone app for the Foscam cameras is AWESOME and even better than the web page interface.

Reviews.Title: Nice product but needs some setup effort.
Reviews.Author: Tushar Tyagi "shell kernel"
Reviews.Content: I could use this camera on my tablet pc and iphone within the house and remotely over the internet. It took around 2 days to get everything working but since then its been fun to use it. The video is crisp. The night vision is amazing. The audio is ok.The build quality is pretty rugged. Pan and tilt control work smoothly. There is no auto focus. I got it to work on windows xp, windows 7 using IE and Mozilla both. Got the iphone Foscam app where the audio does not work.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: Taken price into consideration, it's one of the best deals for a wireless IPcam. The image quality is acceptable, hardware seems decent and all functions work as advertised.The manual that comes with the camera is pretty bad. Instead of trying to decipher poor English in the manual, I would recommend going to foscam website. There are good installation instructions posted there that I had no trouble following.The software that comes with the camera is very basic. Also, I am not sure how good it would be with managing multiple cams as I only purchased one. Another thing to be aware of is that the software comes on a minidisk, which will create problems if you have a slot loading CD/DVD drive.All in all, it's a decent camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Eugene K. Perry
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for monitoring our server room. Setup was extremely easy. Software is excellent for viewing and controlling. The hardware quality including the night vision is also excellent. I would recommend to anyone looking at IP based cameras.

Reviews.Title: Wireless connectivity nightmare
Reviews.Author: Rex-T
Reviews.Content: After hours, I still could not get this thing connected to my wireless network. I have multiple other devices in my home that connect fine, but this camera would not. The manual is a joke, clearly written by someone who doesn't speak English.

Reviews.Title: Too complicated
Reviews.Author: swan50
Reviews.Content: Set up is pretty much impossible to figure out by yourself. Instruction manual is worthless.After about 10 hours of work and use of support line, was able to get the camera to work, but if you want to view through a company firewall, it will not work without having modifications of the firewall or using a non internet explorer browser.These last 2 points mean that this camera has no use to me at all. A complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Need phone support to set up
Reviews.Author: Kristy Seckler "kseckler"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Valuelink which said it came with free phone support. I couldn't get it to work properly and the instruction manual was very limited and confusing. I contacted Valuelink for the phone number for support but got no response. So I contacted the other seller on here IPcam Central. They contacted me back same day and even though I didn't purchase it from them, they helped me to install it correctly. They even followed up to make sure it was running correctly. The product itself is great but you will need support to set it up...so make sure to buy from IPcam Central because their customer service is out of this world! I am going to buy more cameras in the future and will make sure to only buy from them.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: J. Walter
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a video camera to use as a baby monitor. After spending some time researching options, I choose this camera as it satisfied my main criteria: Wireless, Works with all browsers (even iphone), and cost.  For the money, this camera is very good.  I had to purchase through Amazon as I could not find any Canadian re-sellers.  The camera arrived ahead of schedule and was easy to install.  However, the software setup is a bit cumbersome and probably a bit above the average user.  If you know how to setup a router, then you will probably have no problems setting up the camera. However, be prepared to spend at least a few hours tweaking the settings to get it working.The service provided by seller was great and helped resolve the one issue I was having.The great thing is that I can carry around my iphone to keep dibs on my kid when he is sleeping.  Also it is interference free because it works over the wireless network - my last monitor suffered lots of interference because it was an analog device.

Reviews.Title: I/O control available in this model but gone in later models
Reviews.Author: FG
Reviews.Content: Check the difference with later model FI8918W http://www.gadgetvictims.com/2010/10/quick-look-at-foscam-fi8918w.html. I had to buy an old model (this one) to have I/O control in spite of better sound in newer models

Reviews.Title: Foscam Support
Reviews.Author: Sandpaperman
Reviews.Content: Calvin, was my Tech, and helped me within 5 minutes. He took over my computer remotely and helped with port forwarding / password. got my to be able to see my camera on both my computer and I Phone.

Reviews.Title: set up support
Reviews.Author: james l hurst
Reviews.Content: GREAT JOB I AM VERY GRATEFUL FOR THIS SERVICE THAT CALVIN GAVE ME. HE WAS VERY EFFICIENT IN INSTRUCTING THE FULL SETUP.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: dohicky
Reviews.Content: works as  expected and  set up  was easy.  Will use to monitor elderly parent in nursing home for added family patient advocacy

Reviews.Title: FI8908
Reviews.Author: Stephen W. Barton
Reviews.Content: Picture good and sharp, Like all the functions also. Recommend to new custumers. Had cameras for two years, no problems.

Reviews.Title: Works pretty good!
Reviews.Author: Coz
Reviews.Content: 1st off this is not a $1000 camera, so my expectation are tempered. I purchased this one as a test. It did come with instructions. Those along with Google allowed me to get the install done pretty easy. After the wired set up. Wireless set up was pretty strait forward. Although I could not get WPS to auto set up. I had to set the wireless manually.As a test I have it sitting on a ladder 150 feet away in the pole shed. I can view and control the camera with no problems.I believe I have remote access set up and working. I can connect through a computer via myfoscam.org. But its behind my modem. So wife will try it from work. Now for phase two. Order a outdoor PTZ and another one of these.Oh one caviate: I just noticed the Camera they sent me was a F18918W not a F18908W Not sure what the difference is. But for 10 bucks I will keep the one I have.

Reviews.Title: foscam cmeras
Reviews.Author: pedro g.
Reviews.Content: Great support, cameras are great.spoke with Calvin at foscam tech. support and he was great, helped me with everything I needed .fast and knowlageble.

Reviews.Title: Great Kitty Cam
Reviews.Author: Robb Fladry "robb_fladry"
Reviews.Content: I know.. weird that we have a kitty cam, right? Well, we have a back bedroom that our cats sit in all day, and sometimes we like to check in on them from work. I've installed this cam and we use an iPhone app that was about 5 bucks and it works great. This would be great for home security or to check in on a babysitter as well. You have complete control over the pan & tilt and it has night vision for low light situations. The web app isn't designed really well, but it functions well. It's a good cheap wifi cam, and there is a lot of information and uses available on the internet. I recommend this.

Reviews.Title: nice item
Reviews.Author: caveman2
Reviews.Content: it does what is advertised. however the issue is not with the cam, but the configuration with the router, and you have to have a DDNS subscriptionMy cousin in Swtizerland viewed my place in Florida, pan and tilt , wicked neat.

Reviews.Title: Wireless camera connection FI8905W
Reviews.Author: Halbatch
Reviews.Content: The tech rep I spoke to was very knowledgable,helpful, and quickly solved my problem.  Thanks again Foscam.Product is a FI8905W outdoor IP camera.

Reviews.Title: nice cam
Reviews.Author: Tazm35
Reviews.Content: it does what it says it does but would be able to stream online with out doing any web searching etc. needs to just hook up with out software and run the way it's supose to do. other then that great quality.

Reviews.Title: great item
Reviews.Author: Brenda Fisher
Reviews.Content: Works great!  Helps me keep up with the happenings at my home when I travel.  I use my laptop to check things out at home.

Reviews.Title: Wrong Model Sent
Reviews.Author: Trusstopher
Reviews.Content: I, like Tim G, did not get the FI8908W as advertised, but the FI8918W.I will say that, at this price they have this listed and seeing Tim's review, I figured that it would be 8918 I'd receive but it was worth a shot to specify "Foscam Digital Technologies LLC" as who is to fulfill my order and see if his order was a fluke or not.  If definitely was not.As I was looking to only spend around $70 for what ever camera I could get, I'm going to hang on to the 8918 as it does everything I need and wasn't too difficult to set-up, but this being a listing for the 8908 and not the 8918, so I'm giving a 1-star review and really can't speak to the quality of the 8908.  Reading reviews about Foscam's customer service, I'm not sure I'd have much luck trying to get them to swap this out for the 8908.

Reviews.Title: Beware: They sent a different model
Reviews.Author: Tim G
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Foscam FI8908W.  They sent me the Foscam FI8918W.  Not acceptable.  I ordered the FI8908W because I want the I/O ports that are not on newer models.  So I've returned the FI8918W and I will look elsewhere.  Share on these guys for sending a different model from the ad and the order.  If they no longer have the FI8908W then pull it from Amazon.  - Tim G

Reviews.Title: Weird
Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: Really weird and confusing to setup on certain points but its really good. I would probably reccommend getting a differnt web cam though.

Reviews.Title: Starts off ok
Reviews.Author: Wayne Carter
Reviews.Content: I bought 5 of these and I'm finding that they work great for a while, but then get to a point where they just start losing the connection to the network over and over and the only way to reconnect is to reboot, which means dragging out a ladder.  When they are working, they are great.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: brooke s
Reviews.Content: Issue: To set the camera wirelessRicky at foscam support was very quick to resolve the wireless issue!He was very nice and I am pleased with this product!

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM Does Not Work - Hours of Wasted Time.
Reviews.Author: KJCABLES
Reviews.Content: This product was horrible.  The little tiny instruction was impossible to read.  The contact information for technical support is located in HONG KONG.  The camera, although port forwarding was done correctly (with the help of an IT professional) was NOT able to connect to the Internet even though everything was set up correctly. I purchased a DNS via DNS company for $19.99 and they were useless.  I hope to get a full refund.  I spent literally 8 - 12 hours if not more trying to get this thing to work property until I had to call in an IT person.  Even then, it still would not be seen on the internet.  Even a professional IT person with over 25 years experience could not get this thing to work.  I have an older PANASONIC BL-C10 which works great.  Also, I have a MacBook and the PHOTO BOOTH can act as a recording device, although you cannot access via internet but does record nicely.  ALSO the device never moved and never has an option as to where to send whatever VIDEO it captures.  Also the box says "AUDIO" but I put in my BOSE speakers - STATIC - nothing in or out.  JUNK.  Do not buy.  You'll end up returning it like me.  What a huge waste of time and resources and rude people at DNS who were not wiling to help at all.  Dealing with port-mapping via AIRPORT EXPRESS is not an easy thing to do but once you have someone show you - it's fine.  Not worth a dime or your time.

Reviews.Title: Good IP Camera
Reviews.Author: NewtonRob
Reviews.Content: Very good device at a very good price.  I found the setup easy enough. I got it working with no trouble, although setting up networks is not a challenge for me.  This camera worked well with open source IP camera software as well as the software it came with.  I also have software running on an iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8908W review
Reviews.Author: NfHoward
Reviews.Content: Product works fine but the associated software package they provide with the unit is lacking. Audio out of the unit is also marginal quality but sufficient to communicate.

Reviews.Title: i love it..
Reviews.Author: youngbud
Reviews.Content: i love it works well easy to setup, its pretty straight forward. I was reading the reviews about how hard it was to set it up, if your not familiar with IPS, SUBNET, GATEWAY, DYDNS, i guess it could get a little complicated, things like this just dont work outta da box, you need to open ports and foward than depending on your needs, other dan that, good camera.. works great..

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: David Ralph
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 of these little guys. I run Mac OSX Lion. The worst thing was the CD that came with the 1st camera I opened did not work. Luckily I had 2 more and they worked so I was able to get to the set up. Im not going through what I did to get them working other than I plugged the power and ethernet in and used the set up tool. Once the network saw them I was able to configure the wireless pretty effortlessly. I have 2 out of the 3 working now. They work great. Pan, and tilt are easy and I was able to configure my iPhone and iPad very easily. I have not been out of the network yet but I do know they did not work on 3g, which is a shame but that may be something to do with me not having them set right yet. Next stop is using my phone and computer at work on a network. hopefully it will work fine and I will have peace of mind with 2 new babies.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: K-Man
Reviews.Content: It's OK for what I paid. Colors are off because no IR Cut filter. Manual and software not the best and difficult to understand unless your technical. Print in manual is so small you'll need magnifying glass if you don't have perfect vision. Night vision is Good. I bought because software I use, "Security Spy" supported it, and didn't want to spend $600 for the camera  I really liked.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8908W Wireless IP CAM
Reviews.Author: R. Desrosiers "Robbos"
Reviews.Content: For the price this camera is pretty good considering all it does. On the downside; the software works and is not bad to use but the manual is horrible. I had trouble with the Audio and ended up not using it. The most time consuming part was setting it up via Internet due to some issues with Internet Explorer 9, so to be fair it was not a problem with the camera but with I.E.9 In closing I must say that the company support (Foscam) was not available but the Merchant "Loftek" was great and recommend purchasing from them!

Reviews.Title: Great Cam
Reviews.Author: PuertoRock47
Reviews.Content: It's a great cam works great....it a lil work trying to get emails send to your email when the cam is trigger....using the website to view the real time image is great....Great Buy!!!!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for...
Reviews.Author: BigPopaZ
Reviews.Content: Its a good product overall but the software isn't great and the firmware its shipped with is bad.  I went to the website for support and it was down.  I just sent it back because I required more functionality.

Reviews.Title: It does what it says.
Reviews.Author: R. Ford
Reviews.Content: It arrived quickly from Amazon with super saver shipping. Set up was not immediate or intuitive, but the manual (not the get started guide) was pretty clear. Motion detection works. It sends email with pictures when something moves, so I see them immediately on my smart phone when I'm away. I can listen to the camera mic and talk through the computer mic to the camera speaker - startling people who aren't expecting it. It's easy to get started with one camera, then later add more.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: J. A. Brandon
Reviews.Content: These Cams are great for the price. Sent up was easy and they work generally work well. Overall a very good deal for the price. Could use better control features in browers other than IE which uses ActiveX and offers many features not available in other browers.Also, could use a Zoom feature.

Reviews.Title: Works Well - Not Great Setup Materials
Reviews.Author: kc_keg "Casey"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to work with my z-wave home automation system and Mi Casa Verde's Vera2. It was relatively easy to get this to work on its own. The product manuals aren't very good, but some of the other Amazon reviews helped out. Be sure to plug this into your main router. I have two routers and I wasn't able to find it at first when I plugged it into my secondary/z-wave router. Its compatibility with z-wave/Vera is just ok. It took some time on forums to figure it out, but if you're willing to invest some time searching the vera forums for Foscam and then following the instructions it can be done. The quality is pretty good. Even the nightvision is surprisingly good. I have it in a room that's 25 feet deep and in the pitch dark I can see the far wall when the IR vision is on. For the price this is a great buy for anyone willing to do a bit of work to get it setup.

Reviews.Title: Great hardware, horrible set up instructions, minimal written instructions- don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: wowmemalone
Reviews.Content: If you have an extra 24 to 36 hours to spend figuring out how to set up this camera, It is a good buy.  If you are like me, and would like to spend no more than an hour or two, it is a waste of your money.  I finally got it set up to work over the network, wirelessly, but with no help from the manual.  I have yet to get it to send an email to me when it senses motion.The picture quality is OK.  The tilting/panning capability is good.The manufacturing spent a lot of money developing a great camera and no money on customer orientation or making it user friendly.I am now shopping for a new camera and ditching this one.  Too bad-- so much potential.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera, set it up with my Linksys Router and can view on my IPhone 4
Reviews.Author: Nick V
Reviews.Content: According to review sites online, judging from the stickers on the bottom of the unit, I think i got a non-genuine Foscam but i don't care, it works good.  I know a bunch about computers and networking so it wasn't that bad to install.  You kinda need to know what you are doing to get it viewable from the net though, but Google will help. Haven't been able to get the 2 way audio to work yet but i don't have a stand alone mic that i've tried yet.  The mic on the camera works though, i can hear things through my computer from the camera. The gui is very basic but does the job.  Best part is monitoring my Puggle from my IPhone with this camera.  Night vision works sick. I'm buying another to put in my garage for security reasons.

Reviews.Title: FosCam vs TrendNet
Reviews.Author: Michael Finch
Reviews.Content: Great camera, but compared to other budget pan/tilt cameras I have used, it is missing a few features. The output cannot be controlled from the web interface. I've glued a laser pointer to my TrendNet TV-IP422 to entertain my cat. I also cannot bypass the login screen. I generally set my bookmark to [...]However, the night vision is better in this camera, image quality is the same, and it is 1/3 the cost of the TrendNet

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Hradkowsky
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a no-frills camera that is relatively easy to set up, this is a decent choice.Pros: Sets up pretty easy, not a lot of parts to worry about losing.  Nice panning range, and it gives a decent picture.  Works in low light as designed.  It's been working for 2 weeks straight without any problemsCons: Manual's font is tiny, I mean like 4-5 font easy!  You'll definitely need your reading glasses or a magnifying glass. Power cord is way too short at 6' or so.  If you want to mount this on a ceiling somewhere, you'll need an extension cord, which might not be good visually if you can't hide it.  The picture could be bigger, 5½"x7" is as large as it gets.  Interface works best with Internet Explorer (IE) rather than Firefox (FF).  As far as I can tell you can record video through IE but not FF, but you can take a snapshot in FF.  Would be nice if it zoomed in.Summary:  I'm not sorry I purchased this camera as it's full-filling the purpose to which I bought it for.  I can see me getting a better one down the road, that zooms and gives you a bigger monitoring picture, but for now, this one works fine.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat for the price range
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: Software is crap, not bad, just crap.  The camera itself, build quality, feels great.  The software feels like it was outsourced to someone else and written to have a lot of features without an intuitive interface.  IE and firefox also have different interfaces, mozilla (using the generic interface) being the lesser functional.  Works fine as a security camera in applications where a face is clearly visible within 10 feet of the camera.  Far away things will not be as visible, but focus isn't an issue.  Night vision acuity is about 1/2 of the non-IR mode concentrated around the center, things visible near center around 15 feet away through a doorway.  I use this to monitor a remote room in my house (40 feet away with a fridge and 4 walls between the camera and router) when I'm working and I'm happy with the investment.  The camera is a Observer IPCAM made by FOSCAM.  I'm using ActiveWebCam to connect to the camera and use it for motion capture recording.  Active WebCam JPG URL: [...] -Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Bang for Buck
Reviews.Author: J. Garcia "Canon DSLR User"
Reviews.Content: I was looking to get a network cam to monitor the home. I bumped into this cam as a result of reviews. My expectations were set to low and was hoping that it would meet the minimum requirements.
