I used to have an x10 camera set from a very long time ago.Here are my list of pros and cons:Pros:1. product seems well built enough2. stand and the ability of the cam to be mounted in diff configs was great3. low light performance surprised me - images were clear4. Setup is not as easy as users would like and requires some basic understanding of your network infra. But again not complex.5. Was also presently surprised that I could actually transmit audio as well as receive audio from remote through the cam.6. Images for me were pretty clear (640x480) and i was quite surprised since i was expecting worse.7. Pan and Tilt (flip, mirror) are all great with the cam.Cons:1. Of course with products like this - the user manual left me wanting. Not really detailed but enough to get the job done.2. you can log into the device but am worried that there is no HTTPS option3. Web interface is clunky - the activeX control for IE makes my browser crash4. Firefox options gives less control of the cam5. Setup software isnt that great as wellAll in all a great performing product for the price (Got mine for $86). If you compare to other cams this is a much better deal.To top it all off: as others have said. The $5 iphone app is THE perfect companion for the Cam. It almost makes you wish that was what you see in the IE browser for control.

Reviews.Title: Does not work with a mac
Reviews.Author: beth
Reviews.Content: I would strongly advise against buying this camera if you own a mac.  First, when you don't buy directly from the manufacturer, there is no tech support.  Second, the software cd doesn't fit into the drive and you need RAR to open the download software, that actually is designed for the earlier model... Then there are a bunch of quirks that make it not compatible with a mac and you will spend hours (I spent 12) surfing the web to find many, many other people who had the same issue and have ended up, like me, sending it back.  Save yourself the time and frustration.

Reviews.Title: A Mixed Blessing
Reviews.Author: Nom de Plume "Jimbo"
Reviews.Content: For the money this is not a bad product. However, the instuction manual is so poorly written that the user has to experiment and figure out a lot on his own to get this system to work properly.  This is a problem I have with a lot of Chinese-made products - the companies skimp on costs by getting somebody to write an instuction manual who is not fluent in English, and the result is a comedic masterpiece but not an instruction manual. In this case the manual is not only very poorly written with respect to English, but also lacks a lot of information that the user needs to get the system working.  If I were to give an award for the worst instruction manual I've ever had, this would be be the grand prize winner.  Once you do figure out how to set it up the picture quality is pretty good, but by no means high-resolution.  There is a lot of color distortion in the picture under certain lighting conditions.  In one recording my wife was wearing brown pants that looked blue in the recording.  The pan and tilt function work well, and the infrared lighting works well for after-dark recording.  Even though the system is wireless, you will need a wifi signal booster or ethernet cable if you place the camera more than 15-20 feet from your router or if there are physical obstructions such as walls between the router and the camera.  It is BY FAR BEST TO USE AN ETHERNET CABLE to connect it to your router rather than relying on the wireless function - unless you like resetting the system on a regular basis and don't want to depend on it to work all night.  So, know what you are getting when you buy this.  You are not buying a high-end user-friendly system, but it will work well enough if you can figure it out and use an ethernet cable rather than relying on the wireless function.

Reviews.Title: Good starter cam
Reviews.Author: Cowetarent
Reviews.Content: I several rental properties and have always wanted to keep an eye on our parking lots.  We have had some vandalism and other which I will call "strange" occurances.  Only deployed them around the house, but looks very promising especially with my Android phone.

Reviews.Title: Fine webcam
Reviews.Author: KCMO
Reviews.Content: Webcam itself is fine....small footprint and nice motion.  The software interface is kinda weak and basic things like no special characters in your wireless security passphrase is kind of annoying.  The night vision is very solid.

Reviews.Title: Where's Tech Support?
Reviews.Author: AlexL1
Reviews.Content: I received the Foscam FI8918W today.  I purchased it to monitor our 2nd home.  The first part of the installation was very easy, and within 20 minutes the camera was working when connected to the router.I followed the instructions to set it up for a wireless connection.  The instructions were obviously written by someone for whom English is not their first language.I spent the rest of the day trying to make the camera work wirelessly but could not.  I would rate myself as technologically above average.The manual that was included with the camera was so faded that I had to search and download one from the Foscam website.After giving up, for today, I decided to look up tech support, since I'm sure there's something very simple that I'm not doing in the set up.  The [...] website states that they only do tech support for people that buy from them.  I bought from Cable Volume through Amazon, and have not been able to find tech support anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Good baby cam
Reviews.Author: C. Muller "West Coast Waffles"
Reviews.Content: The low light infra-red viewing is good for monitoring a child. The GUI is pretty lousy, For static viewing it is fine, but for panning around the room could be better. I think it is possible to use a different GUI with the camera, but I have not tried this yet. I didn't have too much success being able to view it from outside of my home network. It has been about a year, since I last try it, but it wasn't too intuitive. A little zoom is about all this camera is missing. Maybe a smaller power connector would be nice as well. It is a decent camera though.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: mad as hell
Reviews.Content: I ordered four of these cameras.1 of 4 stopped working on Feb. 1st. after 40 days. End of return period Jan. 31st.The 2nd of 4 just quit today, Feb. 25th, the 64th day.This product is buggy, iffy, and a POS.DO NOT PURCHASE THIS POS PRODUCT. STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Old Forge Slatts
Reviews.Content: I took a gamble after reading the negative articles and they are right on the money.  Connecting via wireless was at best unstable and after a week the wireless wouldn't connect at all.  It's on its way back to Amazon.  Too bad because the panning and video quality are acceptable for the price.  I am fairly sure the one I received was genuine Foscam.

Reviews.Title: camera is ok
Reviews.Author: M. Lisak
Reviews.Content: Camera is ok.  The Seller i would never buy from again.  He says he offers support.  But he charges for it.  Not that great of an experience.  Camera is ok.  Seller is crap.

Reviews.Title: Great IP Camera
Reviews.Author: XenoSaber
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I am very pleased.  The camera works as described all functions.  I was able to watch the pets and gain some great information on their habits.I do have a few things that I didn't like, but they don't effect the functionality of the device.1. It's like dealing with a high-end network device during setup.  Save and reboot, change 1 setting, save and reboot, change another setting, save and reboot, wash, rinse repeat.  This can be a good thing though because you know the settings are being set, it just takes time.2. It didn't come with NVR Software, but it didn't say it did, I just thought that was a given, never assume.At the end of the day, after it's all setup, it's a good cam for the price.  I'd say it would be a bit difficult to setup for someone not computer/network literate, and even then it took me an hour.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the $$
Reviews.Author: David Cardona
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great product, good definition, excellent price, good software, works great with iphoneCons: i miss the zoom capability, the WIFI capability doesnt work good (it works much better with wire)

Reviews.Title: Home User Review Foscam FI8908W
Reviews.Author: BOGY.
Reviews.Content: First here are some pros and cons then I will tell you my story:PROS:Durable constructionNice pictures and videoLots of viewing optionsPan/Tilt works great and has great rangeNight vision acceptableNice hardware designComes with a mount that is very versatileTwo way audio - though I have yet to get it to workWIFI!!!!CONS:Web hosting set upStory:After searching for an IP camera for viewing my children at home while I am at work the Foscam had everything that I could want for a great price.  The shipper sent mine out and it was delivered one day after ordering which was amazing.  When I received the camera I opened the box and installed the quick software (which comes on a mini CD).  The manual is very SMALL and hard to read but I thumbed through it quickly.  So, the camera comes with an Ethernet cable which I plugged on end into the camera and then connected the other end to my Netgear WRN2000 wireless router.  Finally I plugged the camera into power and in seconds I tell you the installed software picked up the camera and showed me its IP address.  Double clicking on the IP address in the software window pulls up IE and the main menu log-in screen.  I logged in and was viewing myself in the cameras point of view.  Pretty cool - pan and tilt - color - brightness - all options there.  But I didn't get this camera for it's plug and play capabilities.  I want wireless.  My TV, Bluray, phone, photo frame are all wireless.  I wanted to be able to place the camera anywhere in the house and not have to worry about running cable to it.  After contacting Foscam tech support I received an email almost immediately. There are TWO MAC addresses under the camera - one for LAN one for WiFi!  Used the WiFi one and boom!  Connected immediately.  The difficulty I had setting up the wifi was because I had the wrong MAC address listed.Also, my DROID phone can connect to it which is what I really wanted.  It's amazing.  Droid Does :)Now I have to figure out how to port forward and web host so I can actually use the camera outside of my network.  Once that is done I will be able to view what the camera sees anywhere in the world!

Reviews.Title: Perfect because of the price and the features
Reviews.Author: Jeferson F. S. Guardia "Jeferson Guardia"
Reviews.Content: I just bought mine yesterday and set it up at home without any probs in about 15 minutes, the process is straightforward if you know you way around in pc's.- Connected the camera to the router via cable, then checked routers dhcp to find out the cam ip address- After I found out the IP address of the cam, I logged in via browser, set up (admin pass, wireless, users accounts, webserver port that would be open and also an internal ip address, a fixed one - better practice)- Then, my IP cam was all good and only thing left was to grant access from outside to the inside, so I went on my wireless router and created a rule telling the router "Hey Router, everything coming to your public IP at por 9090, please redirect to the internal ip address 192.168.1.10(internal ip that I set for my IP cam) at port 9090" and that was it.In 15 minutes I've got the camera fully operational, working all features, also had the chance to plug the sound output to a better sound system, so I could be better heard when talking from the internet.- The built-in mic works great.- The night vision is just perfect, once I shutdown all the lights at home and saw the image quality it was displaying, I just could not believe it, really good.Only problem that I see with this cam -> Its speakers are not very powerful, if you speak a little bit loud, the sound is very noisy on the local site, and is not processed very clear.But yeah, I am planning to buy 3 more of this unit to set up my own surveillance IP system, great stuff!

Reviews.Title: Remote security monitoring
Reviews.Author: F. J. Monaco
Reviews.Content: Forget the manual - you better know something about your home network and dns if you want this to work.  If you do, great product that works with Mac and PC browsers.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied With My Purchase
Reviews.Author: G. Merinstein
Reviews.Content: These little cams do everything I wanted. I purchased 2 of them last month to monitor my aviary at night, and to access the cams from my iPhone4 and HTC Evo during the day.Both worked fine on delivery, although you do have to follow the instructions exactly to set them up correctly. The English fluency of the translator could be better...Last year I purchased two Cisco IP cams for the same purpose at more than twice the price, without pan-tilt and without "night vision", and I am far more satisfied with these Foscam units. I was especially impressed with the infrared night vision (the image looks like a floodlight is focused on the subject area) which is true IR and not just low light with white LED spotlights. I can watch the birds in perfect darkness (for them), although sometimes I see things I would rather not know about (eg. a mouse, who has since been evicted).The only area which could be improved is in the quality of the lens, which exhibits a fish-eye effect at the edges; maybe this is intentional, but better lenses usually maintain the same curvature across their entire field of view. Even so this does not affect their usability at all. I plan to add additional units to provide additional views.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Kim Carty
Reviews.Content: We have a baby and we wanted something other than the typical baby camera monitors.  I had seen a segment on tv where the standard baby monitors can interfere with car gps systems and people driving by could actually see your child on their gps screen. We had tried another product first before my husband found these cameras.  The first camera had poor night vision unless it was plugged in and the batteries would last only about 4 hours. We now have three of these and absolutely love them.  We have computers throughout our house, so the IP address for each camera makes it easy to keep track of a sleeping or awake baby.  These are cheaper than the first camera we used and the night vision is really good.  I love the fact that I can control the camera angle from any computer - very useful in a two story home or if you need to check on pets while you are away.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price...few draw backs
Reviews.Author: B. Mailey
Reviews.Content: First off let me say that this camera is great for the price range and has many of the features a more expensive camera would have. I received this camera and had it up and running within an hour (to be honest I am fairly good with Networks and wireless Networks). The installation would have been fairly challenging without any networking knowledge or background. However, I did use the phone support to fine tune the camera with Ipcam Central, their tech support which was excellent and full of knowledge.Pros for this camera:Pan/Tilt work greatClarity of pictureClarity of Night VisionAlarm monitoringEmail notificationsUPnP supportedDDNS remote access (with port forwarding or Public static IP address)Multi-Device support (up to 9 devices)WEP and WPA2 Wireless security enabledIPhone accessibleCons:Remote access has some delaysIE tab blocks software (there is a work around)Firefox is sluggish and sometime does not allow for Pan/TiltSetup can be a challenge for inexperienced network individualsAudio is lacking and only works sometimes in remote viewingOverall the camera does exactly what it says it does and for a price much lower than that of its competitors. I would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for some home security/ baby monitoring/ or watching children. There are some line items this camera needs to work on but overall the customer support and product are nicely suited and well priced. 4 stars

Reviews.Title: Cool IP camera -  Love the servo drive - Foscam
Reviews.Author: LA Door Guy
Reviews.Content: I bought these to use for web conferencing.  I have not gotten a chance to try that and they may not be the best choice for that purpose.  They are nice cameras that, for the price, have a good look and feel.  They seem like decent quality.I set up the cameras as hard wired with ethernet cables and found it very simple.  They have fair image quality.  Of course we all want great image quality but remember these are modestly priced cameras and considering that they work great.  So far the color seems a bit muted but the image is clear.  The brightness and contract adjustments work well.  The servo drive that can point the cameras remotely works really well.  It does not zoom or focus remotely.The microphone seems a bit low quality.  It is probably intended for a person close up.  The advertisement from the manufacturer says two way audio but I have not figured that out yet.  Seems like that may be a problem with these cameras.  I am not sure.The Amazon seller was great and I go the cameras promptly.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera...mediocre software
Reviews.Author: T. Whitmire "voiding electronics warranties s...
Reviews.Content: This camera overall is awesome, barring the fact that the actual software is only so-so. The online configuration tool is good though. I can view my camera from work and control the pan/tilt/zoom over the `net as well. Pretty cool. I suggest using a third party tool, though as the recording capabilities of the software leave much to be desired. Also, this camera is a bit large, so hiding it will a little difficult for those looking for something covert. I have it on my garage and you can definitely see it from the street, which is fine. I would rather have it be in the open and act as a deterrent anyway.  The camera's  PTZ controls are really responsive and the video I get is smooth. I have it on a wired network as the wireless didn't work from my office to the garage, which are about 60-70 feet away from each other and through 4 walls. The wireless DOES work well, just not at that distance. Your mileage may vary. I tested the wireless down my long hallway with has a clear shot to my office and is about 50 feet long and it works. Its just not good at receiving the signal through walls very well. That's most likely because of the type of router I have. Other than that, this camera is pretty sweet.

Reviews.Title: Overall good - but with some flaws
Reviews.Author: M. Jenoff
Reviews.Content: The camera installed very easily, even the wireless internet feature.  The instruction manual and company's website are horrible.  Camera quality is Ok, but great for the price.

Reviews.Title: Rock Solid
Reviews.Author: William Bowen Sr.
Reviews.Content: I have been using two Foscams FI8908W outside protected somewhat by the overhang of my home now for six months. They are mounted upside down high under the overhangs for the most part protected from direct rain. I live in South Florida with high heat and it rains almost every day. Very steamy conditions day and night here. They are not advertised for use outside.  I am not recommending them to be used in the way I have them installed. I decided to use them this way and willing to replace them if they fail. So far none has.I highly recommend them. The color is slightly off but I did not purchase them to snap family photo for the album. Night time picture quality is reasonable for the price.The installation manual is a bit tough to get through but if you follow each step and take your time when installing them they work as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Overall satisfied
Reviews.Author: Jason Bloom
Reviews.Content: Cons:-Power Cord Too Short-Two-way audio is horrible and shorts out making weird sounds-Software does not function fully in Chrome or Firefox.  Do yourself a favor and use Internet Explorer.Pros:-Great value for the price-Picture Quality is Better than Expected-Easy to Set-up-Great rotation and controlsI would definitely buy several of these cameras.  The price is right and the quality is very good.  Again, if you are concerned with good audio both income and outgoing this is not the right camera for you.  If you are worried picture quality, ease of use, and set-up it is a very good product.  You do have to install software for it to work properly on your computer.

Reviews.Title: Great cam for the price - software lacks
Reviews.Author: Austin Guy 2005
Reviews.Content: I got this to watch over the dog sometimes when we're away from the house for a while...PROS: night vision works really well, pretty clear picture, maneuverableCONS: software is not user friendly as you have to click the up arrow/down arrow/side arrows to get it to move instead of just using the arrow keys, bummer  Must use IE to get sound to work  Not able to move camera with Droid Cell phoneOverall it's a great camera as long as the cons don't get you down (for me they are acceptable as this camera is much cheaper than others with the same features)...

Reviews.Title: Decent hardware, but terrible software
Reviews.Author: connsmythe96
Reviews.Content: I ordered this webcam because it seemed like the best value for my requirements: wireless networking, tilt/pan, and night vision. The hardware seems fine, but I soon found out that the software is severely lacking. There are two web interfaces available. The primary one is ActiveX, so it only works on Windows (and it crashed the browser on Windows 7 64-bit, so not even all Windows versions work). The other interface is just annoying to use. The whole interface seems very outdated and clunky and not very reliable.The worst part is that no matter what I did I could not get it to connect to my wireless network. I have an Apple Airport Extreme Base Station which I have had no problems with using any other device, but this one just would not join the network. I worked with the manufacturer's tech support for over a week trying all kinds of things (turning on SSID broadcast, tweaking security settings, upgrading firmware, etc.), but nothing worked. It just refuses to recognize my network. After over a week I was just tired of messing with it, so I'm going to return it.I strongly suggest that you avoid this camera unless you are willing to risk not having wireless support or possibly spending a lot of time fussing with it to get it to work.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Carolina F.
Reviews.Content: I dont installed it yet , when i isntall it i tell you if i like it or not ..

Reviews.Title: defective
Reviews.Author: benji
Reviews.Content: The camera is fine but came defective as the motion sensor did not function. Was advised to return for cash refund.I did purchase a later model. The camera did give a clear image at night.I boght four other models and had to return them due to bad advertisement and promises the latest one will not sync with Hotmail and they want me to open a gmail account which I refused and am in the process of returning. I have spent more time on the telephone with their technical support team each time I purchase a camera and each time I run into a problem and must return the product. So my advice is stay away from this company.

Reviews.Title: The Seller Is Great & Responsive
Reviews.Author: ISPgeek "ISPGeek"
Reviews.Content: I have no issues with this seller.  The camera has a couple of issues BUT they are small and not worthy of harsh review because its the nature of the beast.  Bottom line the camera works well and I've had no major issues with it.  The documentation however does suck...but anyone with a brain can get it to work.

Reviews.Title: Much better than a fixed lens I've been using for the past year
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Williams

Reviews.Title: JUNK!
Reviews.Author: BarrySDCA "barrysdca"
Reviews.Content: this camera is a piece of junk!  and now I waited too long to complain I can't return it.  save yourself the headache

ProductInfo.Features:
Iphone/mobilephone remote monitoring support. Up to 9 Camera display in one browser view
Pan/Tilt control(Pan:270°& Tilt:120°), Auto night vision (up to 26ft)
MJPEG Video Compression, Multiple cam display, Motion Alarm email support
Wi-Fi compliant with IEEE 802.11b/g. including Apple Airport Express, IE, Firefox, Safary and Chrome, XP, Vista and Windows 7
2-Way audio support with Built-in Microphone,WEP ,WPA and WPA2 Encryption
ProductInfo.Name: Foscam FI8908W Wireless IP Camera with Pan & Tilt, Night Vision, 2 Way Audio, Apple Mac and Windows compatible, Color - Black
